items.title: UX Frontend Developer
items.content:
Bridebook is the UK’s leading wedding planning app and website, backed by some of the smartest investors out there and built with a growth mindset that puts our product above the rest. We are seeking a Front-end Developer to help shape the future of our business as we continue to grow at an incredible pace and prove that a tech-driven startup can take the wedding industry by storm.

You will be responsible for making a journey through our website and app a smooth and beautiful experience by following modern best practices in user interface development. Since launching our site in 2016, we now have over 100,000 couples planning their weddings with us, have been featured by the App Store, New York Times and the BBC, and this is just the beginning.

We are are a self-starting, energetic team that moves very fast. The core of our business is a product that is constantly growing and improving, and everyone in the team is responsible for driving that forward.

*Requirements:*
* Expert in modern ES6 Javascript and React/Redux
* CSS best practices and familiarity with CSS in JS approach (Fela, Glamor, etc)
* Following best practises, including documentation, testing (Jest, Mocha) and defensive programming
* Expert in styling for handheld devices and mobile styling quirks
* Experience with animation libraries

*Responsibilities:*
* Building a sustainable and scalable component library
* Building page layouts from design and spec
* Identifying and defining new and improved product opportunities based on our short and long-term roadmap
* Being a key part of the collaborative and iterative product development process
* Working closely with product managers and developers to help deliver a product that satisfies business and technical constraints
* Seeking out information on new and relevant technologies, testing techniques, refactoring, and documentation practices with the aim of constantly enhancing the performance and efficiency of our product development
* Being the advocate for all things front-end, to ensure we have the best UX/UI to conquer the industry and consistently scale up

*About you:*
* You are committed to writing high-quality code
* You have exceptional communication skills
* You are a strategic and creative thinker with strong problem-solving skills
* You have a track record of helping to build successful products
* You have good attention to detail and are committed to proactively fixing issues
* You have experience working directly with product managers and business stakeholders
* You are willing to learn, self-reflect and gracefully accept constructive criticism

*Additional info:*
This position is open to remote applicants who are based in areas that allow them to comfortably work within our timezone
It is also open to on-site applicants who will be based in our 8th floor Notting Hill office where we have some of the best panoramic views of London

items.title: Silverfin: Frontend Javascript Developer
items.content:
Frontend Javascript Developer

Posted May 14

Silverfin
Headquarters: Gent (Belgium)
https://www.silverfin.com/en/careers
View all Silverfin jobs →

Our product solves a very real problem: it automates and improves a large chunk of the repetitive tasks people working in financial services spend their time on. 

Most of us work remotely. We’re based in France, Estonia, and Slovakia… Without Slack we’d be lonely, now we just zap in and out of the zone as we wish. We’d be really happy to welcome you in our #Dev channel. It’s not just virtual: we make sure we regularly get to see each other IRL too: twice a year we fly the team together.

If this sounds good, here’s more info about the job, and why it’s so challenging. Some say we’re dragging accountants kicking and screaming into the 21st century, but we’re actually trying to keep that kicking and screaming to a bare minimum.

Your job

  • You'll be responsible for everything JavaScript (front-end) together with our other front-end focussed developers
  • Closely work together with our front-end designer and our development teams
  • Define & develop Javascript best practices and teach other developers how to apply them
  • Write reusable JavaScript UI elements/components based on our CSS UI kit
  • Implement front-end features yourself
  • Write and maintain front-end tests

Requirements

  • At least a few years experience working with Javascript professionally
  • Some experience with Ruby on Rails
  • Have some experience with modern JavaScript frameworks and their best practices - we use Vue.js
  • Ability to mentor and guide other developers
  • Work hours that have some overlap with EU business hours (CEST +/- 4h)

Bonus points

  • UI design experience or have an eye for design

What we offer

  • A yearly budget of €1000 for conferences
  • Free to choose your own schedule and work remotely
  • The opportunity to work for an exciting company with a large international customer base
  • A stimulation working environment with passionate colleagues
  • A remote retreat with the developers every 6 months

Apply for this position

Apply through https://boards.greenhouse.io/silverfin/jobs/4031214002

items.content:
Zinc Learning Labs | Senior Software Engineer, Senior Ruby Engineer, Frontend Engineer | Full-time | Anywhere in India | Remote | $36 - $96k

Who: Zinc Learning Labs is a NYC-based start-up that develops innovative, fun, and pedagogically-powerful reading games for middle school and high school students. We are a small team of remote developers in India working along with the product team in NY. Dev team - 4. Overall company size - 12.

What: We’ve developed a web-based app designed to interest students and make them more successful at reading. It provides teachers with detailed analytics to drive learning intervention. We're now working on scaling the product and providing advanced features to aid student learning and empower teachers with more tools to help them see how to guide their students.

Why: We don’t do it just because it’s interesting (though it is). We do it because we’re obsessed with solving one of the most catastrophic, under-acknowledged problems in the US and the world: year after year, students graduate high school without being able to read at the level that is required for success in college and in life.

Where: New York, Bangalore & other Indian cities.

items.title: Full Stack Developer, or something like that
items.content:
Full Stack Developer, or something like that at Troly.io

Sydney, Remote · Full Time
Skills
RESTful Services, Git, Wine, Heroku, Mvc, HTML5 & CSS3, Ruby on Rails, AngularJS, Craft Beer
Compensation
$50K–$80K
0.25%–2.0%

Job Description

You can help!

Troly is always looking for talented individuals. While there are a few boxes to check, we are far most interested by your abilities, your aptitudes and your attitude.

As a Full-Stack developer, you will be required to

→ Assist Customer Success teammates with investigations and liaise with customers to figure things out
→ Contribute new features as requested by customers and in-line with our strategy
→ Make architectural decisions, improve on internal practices and accept nothing less than quality
→ Contribute to architectural documentation and sustainable communications
→ Have an opinion on reds vs white wines

Same as any other roles at Troly;

The appeal of working for "a startup" or in "the industry" just for the sake of it, is unlikely to get you anywhere this time around. We are at a stage where our interest lies in finding founding team members. We will happily expose you to strategy, planning and the entire foundation of the business if and when required.

The right person is not afraid to shake things up or speak up when needed. They will stand their ground when they know they are right, and learn from it when they are wrong.

Technical skills are important, but making sure everyone in the team gets along is even more. We work in a distributed environment, so working alone, using technology for discussions and managing your own time are added challenges you will have to deal with.

Now, we also realise that these kind of people don’t just turn up out of the blue. So we are always on the lookout and are planning to grow based on people, not hire based on growth. In return, you must be committed, and anything measured in months will be considered insufficient.

Finally; if your only goal in life is to make a difference and genuinely help wineries, you really should get in touch. Otherwise, if this sounds like a means to an end, you can simply head over here: https://w.troly.io/u3is8

items.content:
Front End Developer - Ujo Music at ConsenSys

Brooklyn, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$110K–$190K
0.01%–0.01%
Visa Sponsorship
Available

Job Description

Apply Here: https://consensys.net/open-positions/?gh_jid=655974

ConsenSys is a venture production studio focused on building and scaling tools and enterprise software products powered by Ethereum. Our mission is to use these solutions to power the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, security and infrastructure, and more. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

At Ujo we’re building a home for artists that allows them to own and control their creative content and be paid directly for sharing their musical talents with the world.

Ujo Music is currently seeking a Front End Developer to add to its growing team.

Requirements:

* Expert knowledge of JavaScript
* Experience working with React/Redux or similar front-end frameworks
* Current with the state of the JavaScript eco-system (ES6, Babel, NPM, Webpack, Rollup, etc.)
* Strong design focus with commanding grasp of HTML, CSS, and related web technologies
* Ability to use design patterns to create simple and reusable components for complex UIs
* Awareness of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations
* Familiarity with continuous integration and deployment
* Basic knowledge of relational and non-relational data stores like MongoDB, etc.

Bonus Points:

* Basic fluency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop/Illustrator/etc.)
* Knowledge of Web3 and Ethereum development tools
* Excited about the prospects of decentralized technologies
* Love for music and the desire to impact the way the world interacts with it in a positive and sustainable way

items.title: Lead Developer
items.content:
Organisation - Third Way Legal (www.thirdway.pro)

Role - Lead / Full Stack Developer

Location - Bond Street / Marble Arch

Tools & Technologies:

Back-End:
• C# 6.0 Programming Language
• Microsoft SQL Server 2014 Database
• ADO.NET Data Access

Front-End:
• ASP.NET MVC 5.0
• Twitter Bootstrap 3.3.7 Responsive Front-End Framework
• HTML/CSS (LESS)/JavaScript (TypeScript)/jQuery

Company Description

Law firms and in-house legal teams spend hundreds of millions annually to attract the top legal candidates in the UK alone. But lawyers are terribly served by traditional recruitment agencies, who rely on anonymised web ads or inexperienced cold callers to engage potential legal recruits.

Our founders, Tom Balmer and David Crocker, have been involved in the establishment and growth of some of the best names in the legal recruitment industry since the early noughties. In 2017 they launched Third Way Legal, a marketplace platform designed to change the way lawyers engage with the jobs market.

Third Way is a unique network, where lawyers can confidentially see which firms are looking for lawyers like them (in some ways it is similar to workinginstartups.com!). Following an amazing first year, where we have grown to 6 people and are annualising a million in turnover, we now are looking to build an in-house tech team.

It's an extremely exciting time to join the business. We are expanding into the interim market, looking to grow into new geographies, and have so many new feature ideas it hurts. We're looking for a full-stack developer, comfortable with front and back end development, who is pragmatic and can eager to grow with the firm. If that sounds like you, and you'd like to join us on our journey to change the legal recruitment industry, please get in touch!

items.title: MyHub Intranet Solutions: DNN Web Developer - Work From Anywhere In The US
items.content:
DNN Web Developer - Work From Anywhere In The US

Posted May 11

MyHub Intranet Solutions
Headquarters: New Zealand
https://www.myhubintranet.com
View all MyHub Intranet Solutions jobs →

“Exciting International Software as a Service company with exceptional growth and prospects. Beat the daily commute, work from home anywhere in the US!”

Live the work/life balance dream, beat the daily commute, work from anywhere in the US. Based in Auckland New Zealand, we operate a 100% remote working policy with people based in the US and Europe. The company doesn’t just pay lip service to work-life balance, we live it every day, with flexible time throughout the day, to balance work and family commitments.

Please note: This is a permanent fulltime contacting role, the successful applicant will be paid monthly and will be entitled to up to 5 days sick leave and 4 weeks paid leave per annum. Medical and other benefits will not be provided by the company nor will computing equipment, however, an allowance for these items will be included in the monthly payment.

We have a vacancy for an experienced DNN Developer who will be tasked with helping the continued development of a well-established web-based product in the global marketplace. We are looking for an enthusiastic intermediate to senior level .Net web developer who has proven experience developing custom web-based solutions using the DNN framework.

The ideal candidate will also have experience in the hosting, optimization and scaling of the DNN CMS platform. Experience around the user experience and modern presentation layer best practices is also desirable.

Job Purpose

  • Play a key technical development role in helping shape the systems and processes associated with the development, support and delivery of new products, solutions and platforms.
  • Work with the management team to provide development solutions that will support online business development, product support, roadmap and marketing activities.

Key Responsibilities

  • The development and delivery of back and front-end code. This includes but is not limited to the development of C#, HTML, CSS, XML, JavaScript, JQuery, SQL queries and database design.
  • Delivery of front-end code designed for the best possible user experience. Where practical implementation of modern presentation layer best practices.
  • The development and delivery of hosting optimization, caching and scaling of the DNN CMS platform.
  • Continual development project progress reporting to line management.
  • De-risk the businesses software delivery lifecycle activities by working with other staff to ensure that proven methodologies are implemented and adhered to. Ensure that all backend and frontend code is delivered in line with modern best practices where practical.
  • Manage and where possible improve the development and change control processes across all environments and systems.
  • Work to resolve technical issues. Assist with the implementation of processes and policies to limit future occurrences.
  • Work with the management team to set goals designed to improve personal performance.
  • Work closely with both the management team and other technical resources using clear communications.
  • Play a key role from a development perspective in business analysis activities associated with the development of new products, solutions, platforms and internal business systems.
  • Where required ensure that requirements are effectively documented in order to de-risk delivery.
  • Proactively identify and communicate new product roadmap development and cost reduction opportunities for the business. Actively participate in the development and delivery of customer services solutions for the business as demand grows.
  • Work with the management team to help with the sourcing and onboarding of new technical staff into the business.

Requirements

  • DNN commercial development experience 2+ years
  • Several years .Net and MySQL commercial experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of optimization, caching and scaling techniques
  • Experience using IIS, HTML (XHTML, HTML4/5), CSS, Media Queries, XML
  • Experience using modern JavaScript frameworks, jQuery
  • Familiarity of web usability and W3C standards
  • Experience working in an Amazon Web Services environment
  • Dedicated workspace to be able to work from home
  • High-speed home broadband connection
  • Very strong teamwork skills
  • Self-motivated problem solver with a strong work ethic
  • Ability to work remotely and survive long periods of time without physically seeing your co-workers (although you will be in daily communication with your team via email and video chat)
  • Some travel required

Apply for this position

If you think that you are up for the challenge and would like to discuss working with our awesome team, please get in touch. To be considered for this position can you please send your resume along with a cover letter outlining why you feel you will be suitable for the role to mike.mcminn@myhubintranet.com

Front-End Software Engineer for Cloud App in .NET

Posted May 10

OnePager
Headquarters: Centennial, CO
http://www.onepager.com

Join a high-powered group of people who write amazing graphics softwarefor project planners around the world.  Our customers love us because wemake communicating project plans so much easier.  We are anagile-methodology company and encourage flexible work arrangements. Most (butnot all) of us are in the Denver area, but we all work from home and gettogether in small groups when it makes sense.  Your job is to be a major contributor on our new SPA cloud app built with anASP.NET Core 2.0 back end.  This app is quite challengingbecause our customers expect it to be as powerful as our rich desktop apps.  Infact, it's likely that you've never worked on an app like this before.  We're looking for someone eager to meet the challenge of putting a high-function graphics application in the cloud.  Weare confident that we can get it to market and achieve success, but we could use your expertise especially if you've been down the SPA road and have learned some lessons from experience.

Minimum Required Skills:
  • 3-5 years experience with C#, JavaScript
  • Experience with ASP.NET MVC
  • Proven skills at software design, coding, unit-testing, troubleshooting,and customer interaction.

Desirable Experience:
  • Experience with Single-Page Applications in Angular, React, Vue.js, ... 
  • Experience with .Net Core 2.0

Other Job Requirements:
  • Strong English
  • Time zone: Mountain Standard Time (Denver) +- 3 hrs

Apply for this position

E-mail your resume, cover letter, location (country/time zone), and compensation requirements to careers@onepager.com. No telephone calls, third parties, or outsourcing proposals, please. Check out what we do at our web site: www.onepager.com.

Headquarters: Mississauga, Canada
http://snapprojections.com/careers/
View all Snap Projections jobs →

Want to help us make a difference in the lives of millions of Canadians? I’ve got a position for you.

THE BIG PROBLEM YOU’LL BE WORKING ON

We have an engineering team. They’ve build a great product.

BUT our users are asking for more features and we can’t keep up. As we add more users and our datasets grow, we want to make sure our systems scale well, remaining performant and secure.

And we’d LOVE to have another Software Engineer join us to help us scale our systems. That person is you.

YOU’LL MAKE GREATER IMPACT IN 3 MONTHS THAN YOU DID IN 3 YEARS AT YOUR LAST JOB

At Snap Projections, you’ll own your projects and be given a chance to implement and test your own ideas.

I’m not going to lie, the technical problems we solve on the engineering team aren't simple. But this also means you’ll be able to do work that matters and help a ton of people in a way you've never imagined.

So if you’ve ever wanted to be on a team that’s focused on making a massive difference in the lives of millions of people, I want to talk to you.

If financial topics interest you and you want to help Canadians make better financial decisions, you’ll love it.

WE’RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHO HAS…

- 4+ years experience designing, building, and scaling systems and user-facing features.
- Experience with Java SE, Groovy, Grails, Hibernate, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, SQL.
- Experience with scaling and AWS.
- Experience in several of the technologies we are using. You don’t need to be an expert in all of them. We are looking for someone who is already comfortable across various layers of the tech stack and eager to learn additional technologies as needed.
- Enjoy designing, building and scaling systems to make them fast, while still being nicely maintainable.
- Care a lot about product and user experience, and is able to think like a user. We are looking for someone who doesn’t need to rely on a designer to figure UX stuff out for them.
- Be comfortable in a quickly changing environment, with a small team and a lot of responsibility.

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW

- This is a full-time position either based remotely in Canada or at our offices in Edmonton, Alberta or Mississauga, Ontario.
- Competitive salary and stock options if you’re a star performer.

Apply for this position

HOW TO APPLY- Email your resume at pawel(at)snapprojections.com.- Put “Software Engineer” in the subject line and nothing else.- Tell me why you want to work at Snap Projections.- Give me a quick overview of one of your projects that you are especially proud of.If you’ve included everything requested in your email and your application is solid, I’ll reach out and we’ll jump on a call. The rest of the interview process will continue from there.I hope we get a chance to work together.PawelPawel BrzeminskiFounder & CEO

items.title: Senior Software Engineer at Eedi (London, UK)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time

Job description

Eedi is removing the guesswork...

Eedi is removing the guesswork from education by providing the right information, right when teachers, learners, parents and publishers need it. We're ambitious but humble - education is notoriously conservative, so we listen to our users - and that more than anything we believe that our solutions should be accessible to anyone, anywhere.


Despite a tough environment we've grown quickly:

  • 100M data points
  • 9,000+ schools
  • 850,000+ students
  • 103 countries worldwide


If you want a challenge and the feeling of fulfilment at the end of everyday, we want you to make your mark with us.


What's the opportunity?

Frontend Engineers are an essential part of Eedi's Product Team. Working closely with designers, we implement the user interface of our web app. We make the most of modern tools like React, ES6, and SASS, and we ensure our UIs work well on all screen sizes. Some of us specialise in CSS, some in front-end infrastructure, but all of us are JavaScript pros and full-stack engineers.


Eedi is an incredibly rare opportunity to join a company that is still small but on it’s way to something much bigger, with a meaningful transformative mission, where you would work closely with the product and engineering team. The team is already doing a lot of great things, but we still have our best work in front of us. This is more than a technical role, you'll be a creative product and technical contributor. You'll use your experience to inform our engineering process and decisions when building new features and ensuring scalability and availability of the entire platform.


What will I be doing?

  • Collaborate with Experience Designers to iterate on the design and implementation of our product
  • Work with Data Scientists and Backend Engineers to build features and ship experiments
  • Build efficient and reusable front-end systems and abstractions
  • Find and address performance issues
  • Participate in design and code reviews
  • Identify and communicate front-end best practices

Benefits


  • Remote working (must be UK-based)!
  • Competitive salary and meaningful equity
  • Regular compensation reviews - great work is rewarded!
  • 30 days holiday and a week off over Christmas
  • Flexible working so you can avoid the rush hour or work from home or elsewhere
  • Open source community involvement (8 hours per month to give back to the React community)
  • Peace of mind with life assurance, income protection and generous pension contributions
  • Paid maternity leave, as well as 6 weeks paternity leave for fathers, to let you spend valuable time with your loved ones

About Eedi


Eedi's simple mission; to create happier, more fulfilled children.

We believe that the provision of a better education for all has the potential to change the world and that by doing so it can create greater life chances, a more dynamic workforce that is able to adapt to whatever happens next and a more informed population that is less easily manipulated and through a wider base of knowledge is able to engage with the important decisions of today and tomorrow.


Create - We build elegant, intuitive experiences for our community.

Learn - We look inside and outside for inspiration and learning.

Play - Life should be an adventure. We make sure to enjoy it.

items.title: Senior Frontend Engineer at Lottery.com (Austin, TX)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer, Mobile Developer
Industry: Gaming, Mobile Application
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Have strong opinions about software engineering?  Love what you do and working with passionate coworkers?  Lottery.com’s engineering team is hiring!

Reports To: Director of Engineering

At Lottery.com we’re assembling a world-class team of brilliant minds, resourceful doers and creative problem-solvers with a ‘find a way or make a way’ attitude. Founded in 2015 and based in San Francisco, California, Lottery.com is creating the next generation of lottery ticket sales & ticket management systems. We make buying and redeeming lottery tickets more convenient, secure and intelligent through our mobile application and online platform. We look for candidates that demonstrate what we call the “three Is” -- Intelligence, Integrity and Intrinsic motivation.

Our frontend engineering team is our product.  We support multiple different applications, each on both Android and iOS powered by React Native.  Engineering at Lottery.com is divided into several squads, each on the smaller side at 5-6 engineers. We bias towards passionate engineers who bring experience, well reasoned opinions and a variety of perspectives to the table. We encourage honest debate and emphasize concrete, forward-thinking solutions. We operate on a weekly schedule, have regular internal demos/tech talks, and a weekly retrospective. We’re experienced and confident but have no ego, we’re open minded and constantly looking for ways to improving ourselves and our processes.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement user facing features in React Native for our applications iOS and Android applications.
  • Work as a team with your peers, collaborating on product design, mentoring teammates and pushing our entire platform forwards.
  • Partner with the product and design teams to ensure we are building efficient and beautiful designs.
  • Focus on reusability and best practices, stay up to date on latest innovations in our industry and within our stack
  • Help us push the boundaries on what a small team can produce and maintain with simple code and well thought out architecture.

Requirements

  • 5+ years experience developing mobile applications, including expertise with Android, iOS and/or React Native.
  • A portfolio of beautiful and functional visual implementations on mobile platforms
  • Ability to pass background check, has appropriate work authorization
  • Constant positive, can-do attitude that helps motivate and encourage your whole team.
  • An ability to always focus on the company objectives and the mission at hand.
  • Ability to work remotely and independently, but be available on Slack and sync up to our time-zone (PST) for meetings and discussions.
  • Familiarity and comfort working in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Honorable discharge (military only)

Bonus

  • Experience in ReactJS / React Native / React-Native-Web
  • Familiarity with WordPress / Web design standards and development
  • Comfortable with / passionate about giving internal tech talks / writing for company engineering blog





About Lottery.com

Make People Happy. 

Benefits

Unlimited Vacation
Premium Healthcare
Flexible work hours / work from home

items.title: Full Stack Developer at Much Better Adventures (London, UK)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time

Job description

About us

Much Better Adventures is fast becoming the leading marketplace for one of the fastest growing sectors in travel - adventure. We're on a mission to inspire people to live a more adventure-rich life, help a global community of local and independent businesses to make a great living doing what they love, and protect the planet’s most inspiring natural landscapes in the process.

We were voted the UK’s ‘Best for Experiences’ in 2016, are continually rated 5* by our tribe of loyal customers, and are founded by the UK's 'Young Travel Entrepreneurs of the Year' 2017.

We’re backed by some of Europe’s leading investors and entrepreneurs, and are partly-community owned. Now we're building a team of super talented, passionate and ambitious people to join us.


The role

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working on all aspects of web development with a leaning towards the infrastructure and architectural aspects of the job. For the right candidate there will be opportunities to carve out a leading role in the infrastructure side of the business as the team grows. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

You will be keen to learn and leverage new technologies best suited to the task at hand. Our stack is broad and wide ranging: https://stackshare.io/much-better-adventures/much-better-adventure.

You will be joining a small, cross-functional product team and be expected to dig in to all facets of the products' development.

As a full-stack developer in the Much Better Adventures product team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in Python/Django, JavaScript/React, and PostgreSQL.



Benefits


If you want to disrupt one of the fastest growing sectors of travel, get a kick out of supporting local and independent businesses around the world, and are in your element on skis, a bike, a surfboard or something equally exciting, you are in the right place.

  • Competitive salary with share options
  • An entrepreneurial environment where great ideas are actively encouraged, and taking responsibility for them is expected
  • Flexible working arrangements - work where/when you want
  • 25 days paid holiday a year, plus 5 extra days to experience a Much Better Adventure or two each year.
  • Monthly company meet-ups in a variety of inspiring and adventurous settings
  • Budget and time for continued learning and self development, including courses, monthly audible/books budget, and access to training, classes and talks from Europe's leading entrepreneurs and mentors
  • Budget for home-working set up, your choice of laptop etc
  • Pension scheme (UK-based employees)
  • The warm fuzzy feeling that comes with knowing you are making a huge difference to small independent business, local economies and communities. Did we mention our Foundation?

Application process

We'll do short video calls to get to know each other a bit better, and in-person or longer video interviews with the top candidates after that.

About Much Better Adventures

The way we travel is changing. This is the work-hard, play-harder generation. We are time-poor, experience-hungry, and usually have a nightmare trying to organise our next trip...

So we're here to sort it out.

Much Better Adventures is fast becoming the leading marketplace for one of the fastest growing sectors in travel - adventure. We're on a mission to inspire people to live a more adventure-rich life, help a global community of local and independent businesses to make a great living doing what they love, and protect the planet’s most inspiring natural landscapes in the process.

We were voted the UK’s ‘Best for Experiences’ in 2016, are continually rated 5* by our tribe of loyal customers, and are founded by the UK's 'Young Travel Entrepreneurs of the Year' 2017.

We’re backed by some of Europe’s leading investors and entrepreneurs, and are partly-community owned. Now we're building a team of super talented, passionate and ambitious people to join us.

If you want to build a global travel-tech business in one of the fastest growing sectors of travel, get a kick out of supporting local and independent businesses around the world, and are in your element on skis, a bike, a surfboard or something equally exciting, you are in the right place.

----

You can see our current openings below.

Nothing there quite you? Fear not. We always like to hear from awesome people in the tech, marketing, sales, travel and creative worlds, so feel free to contact us anytime if your perfect role isn’t listed above just now.

No agents please (unless you’re looking for a career change) ;)

items.content:

Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Information Technology, Software Development, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 201-500 people

Job description

Authority Partners is seeking a Senior Web Developer with top-notch programming skills to join our strong development teams. The Web Developer will design and write maintainable code, communicate with teams and clients, as well as deliver products within an aggressive schedule.  

REQUIREMENTS:

  • 5+ years of proven working experience in web programming
  • High proficiency coding in C#
  • In-depth knowledge of modern Angular, JavaScript, Web Services, HMTL and CSS
  • Strong grasp of programming principles

  • Good working knowledge of English Language

BONUS SKILLS:

EDUCATION:

Authority Partners isn’t just an IT company. It’s a community of global technology experts collaborating with our client partners to build enterprise solutions. Today, we are more than 200 strong and one of the Most Preferred Employers in Bosnia and Herzegovina seven years running. We are always on the lookout for talented, passionate and hardworking individuals to join our team and develop their career in software development, quality assurance analysis, program management, business analysis, etc. We are committed to helping our employees achieve their career success.

items.title: Angular/Ionic Full-Stack Engineer at Clevertech
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Mobile Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is seeking an Angular/Ionic Developer Full-stack Developer to join us in developing premium native experiences for our consumers. In this role, you will deliver well designed, highly testable, and resilient applications. You will also be instrumental in driving our mobile technology roadmap forward and evangelizing mobile development and testing practices. The successful candidate is both deeply experienced with mobile development and a team player that thrives in a collaborative agile environment.

You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of software development experience
  • Strong JavaScript coding experience
  • Ionic framework experience required
  • Minimum 3 years of cumulative mobile app development, design, and/or architecture experience with technology experience from at least one of the following areas:
  • Server-side/Middleware (REST API services, microservices)
  • Native Applications (iOS, Android)
  • Exposure to Java/Postgres backend
  • Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
  • A solid grasp of fundamental algorithms and mobile applications
  • Deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, a related field or equivalent work experience
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.ability to lead and mentor others
  • Knowledge about the Lean Startup and Agile Methodologies

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself

You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentor-ship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here. And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag

And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

About Clevertech

We’re always looking for smart, driven, entrepreneurial developers to join our team.

If you like new ideas and want to work with a virtual but absurdly talented group of people in a learning-friendly environment, check out the open positions.

No matter what you do at Clevertech, you'll play a part in transforming ideas into software that changes the world.

Just answer a few quick questions and learn a little more about our culture.

We’re waiting for you, and ready to do great things together!

Benefits

Full-Time Telecommuting
Flexible Schedules
Paid Time Off
Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
Contribute to Open Source

items.title: Senior Angular Engineer
items.content:
Senior Angular Engineer - Jobmote

Senior Angular Engineer

Nrwl

Are you a Senior Angular engineer who continually self-trains to build cutting-edge skills?  Do you love the challenge of helping teams with real-world product goals? Want to play with Angular thought-leaders and enterprise development teams?

We Have:

  • Distributed company with folks all over North America
  • Flexibility for you to work from anywhere / anytime
  • Industry thought-leaders and great developers
  • Fortune 500 tech , finance, and other enterprise clients
  • Work on Open-Source Nx Platform and other products around Angular and Nx
  • Work on Angular, Schematics, CI/CD, and UX
  • Fun, challenging work

You Have:

  • Great Angular skills / and depth of understanding of the framework and ecosystem
  • Serious understanding of Ngrx
  • Desire to work on code, teaching, speaking… many options
  • Desire to work and collaborate with great developers
  • Desire to work remote or - perhaps - have some travel
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

You might also have:

  • Deep understanding of AngularJS
  • Skills with Angular UI components (Angular Material ++)
  • Skills with UX
  • Skills with NodeJS
  • Skills with CI/CD, Docker, GraphQL

About Us

Nrwl is not a staffing firm, and we don’t build applications for clients. Our teams work as turbo-charger partners for existing client development teams. We are hiring the best folks from the Angular community. We work with great clients, on exciting projects; you will not be bored.

We also offer top-of-market compensation, offer equity, provide unlimited sick days, and four weeks of vacation.

Even though Nrwl is a distributed company, Toronto (and soon Phoenix) are our main development offices. Having a bunch of folks in the same city can be useful when tackling larger problems. So you should to be in office city or willing to move. Exceptions may be considered based on experience and roles. No international considerations at this time; you must be an located in the North America continent.

Learn More

Learn more about Nrwl at nrwl.io and blog.nrwl.io.

Nrwl is not a staffing firm, and we don't build applications for clients. Our teams work as turbo-charger partners for existing client development teams. We are hiring the best folks from the Angular community. We work with great clients, on exciting projects; you will not be bored.

We also offer top-of-market compensation, offer equity, provide unlimited sick days, and four weeks of vacation.

Even though Nrwl is a distributed company, Toronto (and soon Phoenix) are our main development offices. Having a bunch of folks in the same city can be useful when tackling larger problems. So you should to be in office city or willing to move. Exceptions may be considered based on experience and roles. No international considerations at this time; you must be an located in the North America continent.

Learn More

Learn more about Nrwl at nrwl.io and blog.nrwl.io.

items.title: Graduate Developer - 1yr experience +
items.content:
We're looking for a talented Graduate Developer to join our growing Team in London. We need someone with a Comp Sci degree, who likes to ask questions, listen and then deliver.

We are a fast-growing open source business, competing and winning against the biggest names in tech.

We are an inclusive and diverse team, in part because we offer fully flexible working, remote working, unlimited paid holiday and a culture/decision making based on open source.

*Who are Tyk?*
We are a funded startup founded in 2015 based out of London and Singapore and with half our team remotely located across every continent (not antarctica. yet.) We have many thousands of users of our B2B platform across the globe.

*The Technology*
Our product is based on Go and AngularJS, its deployed with Mongo and Redis on AWS with Docker.
Our product is used by clients running everything from shiny micro-service architectures to sucky SOAP stuff they keep in the company museum.
As a result, we are pragmatists over technology choice, enjoy problem-solving and want your involvement in shaping our future choices.

*What can you do with us?*
We’re looking for a Graduate Software Engineer who’s keen to engage with our team and our clients and help shape the way the company and our product is built.

We want someone who is independent and capable of taking responsibility for delivery. Our thriving community and our enterprise customers are the people you need to satisfy. We are fanatical about listening to our clients. We need someone who likes to ask questions, listen and then deliver.

You’ll join our Shoreditch based (yeah, we have exposed brick, hipster coffee, skinny jeans…) team where you’ll be tasked with working on real projects to enhance our product range, troubleshooting client issues and contributing to the product roadmap. Tasks will range from developing complex web applications, looking for new innovations and identifying opportunities to grow and improve the Tyk offering as well as some (very) technical support.

*Essential Skills:*
• First and foremost you must be a logical thinker with an inquisitive nature, a natural passion for technology and a desire to learn and progress quickly
• A passion for building great software
• Ability to talk with clients and understand their requirements
• A degree in Computer Science or related discipline

*Desirable skills:*
• Experience building object oriented applications
• MongoDB
• Javascript Development

*Bonus skills:*
• DevOps skills
• Experience in API Management
• Github projects you’re proud of

*Our Mission*
The internet started by connecting mainframes, by the end of the 20th century 600m desktop and laptop computers exchanged email and web-traffic.
Today around 15 billion ‘things’ are connected to the internet, growing at a rate of a billion per year.
Tyk are committed to enabling interconnectivity between systems and between devices. We’ve started by building an API Management platform.

*Benefits*
Our early stage team members are shaping our business, there is an attractive package based on experience and performance.
Everyone has unlimited paid holiday.
Work with a talented, passionate team of industry experts, developing a cutting-edge product that is driving change and innovation within startups and household names alike.
A distributed team. Work from our London office during induction, once you are up to speed, you can work from home, a cafe, your mums house, your kids nursery, wherever you get your best work done, we’ll support you in making that happen.

The best software and hardware available – we are prime movers in “The New Stack”, our setup reflects that.


We are growing rapidly and are looking for team members keen to grab hold, accelerate that further and shape our future. You can see more about us here www.tyk.io
Please send a CV/Résumé and cover letter

items.title: PhoneGap 2 PWA Developer + 1M CarpoolToken ICO JavaScript JS JQM JQuery
items.content:
PhoneGap 2 PWA Developer + 1M CarpoolToken ICO JavaScript JS JQM JQuery at FUNcation by We Carpool @YCobinatorSS17

Reston, Remote, Remote · Cofounder
Compensation
$0K–$50K
5.0%–10.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Available

Job Description

Complete assessment x3em.com/25

We believe we can change the future of our cities for the better. Help people come home faster, breathe cleaner air, save energy and money and protect our environment. Change the world of transportation in your city with us! We're looking to add another good JS developer to our team. We're in Reston, VA but open for remote option as well. Cool perk: enjoy free carpool rides for life of your employment.

Of course you can work for Google but no you can't be employee No 6 there. Google pays you so you do not compete with them. You're better than that. Don't loose this opportunity of a lifetime. React Native is a plus.

Bonus: one million CarpoolCoin (ICO)
Why us?
1. Remote Work Environment! Yes! Cool!
2. Meaningful Projects impacting the world
3. Coolness Factor
4. Discounted and free Events tickets
5. Ability to Have an Impactful Voice
6. An Excellent Company Culture
7. Free daily transort to/from work (coming soon)
8. Get access over $25,000.00/month in free cloud and development software from MS Bizspark and IBM Cloud programs

Send link to your best code samples and fill out questionnaires and send back screenshots http://x3em.com/25

Startups also give you more opportunities for mastery. You’ll be faced with a huge variety of tasks and you’ll constantly have to learn new things as you go. You might be writing database queries one day, designing a user interface the next day, answering customer service emails the day after that, and putting together an investor pitch deck in between. You’ll develop skills that will be useful for the rest of your career and you’ll learn to deal with pressure, stress, and risk. You’ll be pushed beyond your comfort zone, which is where learning really happens. This is why many people learn more in three months at a startup than three years at a big company.
In a startup, all you have is a bunch of guesses about what might work in the market, and the focus is on search. It turns out that searching is a lot more fun.
Even the “crappy” days at a startup can be fun. The ghetto office, the need to scrape by on a budget, the constant sense that you have no idea what you’re doing can all be terrifying, but also exciting. They teach you to appreciate the small victories in life rather than becoming obsessed with promotions or politics.

items.title: NewsBank, inc.: Senior Front End E-Commerce Developer
items.content:
Senior Front End E-Commerce Developer

Posted May 8

NewsBank, inc.
Headquarters: Naples, FL
http://newsbank-inc.breezy.hr/p/9ecb3d7ecc2c-senior-front-end-e-commerce-developer/apply
View all NewsBank, inc. jobs →

GenealogyBank is seeking asenior front end developer to join our team.  You will have demonstratedexperience with website functionality and e-commerce systems. 

In this role, you will befocused on web development of client-side components and pages using the latestJavascript frameworks and mobile optimization best practices. 

You will have effective, crossfunctional communication skills as you work in conjunction with designers,back-end developers and marketing team to execute effectively.

Thisis an exciting opportunity for you to play a major role in taking one of thelargest websites for family history research to the next level of success.We’re looking for a candidate who shares our enthusiasm for developing anamazing product and enjoys teamwork.

Responsibilities
  • Develop client-side applications using the latest JavaScript language features, frameworks, and tooling. 
  • Performance optimization work including: profiling, time to first byte, browser memory usage, decreasing the overall load time of applications and hitting first meaningful paint. 
  • Expertise in the latest front-end technologies (i.e., HTML5, CSS3, Responsive Design, etc.), as well as website development process and CMS publishing (Wordpress, Drupal etc.)
  • Serve as the resident expert for all consumer marketing front-end development and e-commerce related questions and issues.
  • Deep experience with Google Analytics, transactional and ecommerce platforms, CRM and ESP to develop, implement and oversee marketing technology stack. 
  • Drive all aspects of the development and implementation of SEO plans and campaigns.
  • Oversee written code, manage and ensure ongoing training of front end developer to create, design, update, and modify web applications.
  • Serve as a liaison with the development and marketing teams to design and implement new and on-going functionality of site to acquire new leads and subscribers.  

    Qualifications
    • 5+ years of  industry experience in a transactional environment
    • Strong foundation in design patterns, data structures and algorithms
    • Knowledge of SCM tools such as Git, GitHub, etc.
    • Deep knowledge of eCommerce systems including shopping carts, CRM and ESP
    • Experience in creating Single Page Application using Angular.js 2 or React.js. Familiar with using Bootstrap for responsive design 
    • Certification in and strong knowledge of Google Analytics in addition to rank tracking tools (Linkdex, SEMrush, Conductor, Moz, etc.).
    • Expert knowledge of SEO tactics across large scale campaigns
    • Solid experience and understanding of HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript
    • Solid experience with IOS mobile applications and design
    • An interest in genealogy always helps!  

    Become a key member of our highly motivated teamand share in our continued success. This position can be remote, or based inour Naples, FL, Keene, NH or Chester, VT offices.

    Apply for this position

    To apply, click on URL: http://newsbank-inc.breezy.hr/p/9ecb3d7ecc2c-senior-front-end-e-commerce-developer/apply and upload cover letter and resume

items.title: Senior Lead Software Engineer at Oliver Wyman Labs (New York, NY)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Agile Software Development, Consulting, Machine Learning
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Public

Job description

OW Labs Senior Lead Engineer

Oliver Wyman is a global leader in management consulting. With offices in 50+ cities across 25 countries, Oliver Wyman combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, and organization transformation. Our 3,000+ professionals help clients optimize their business, improve their operations and risk profile, and accelerate their organizational performance to seize the most attractive opportunities. Our professionals see what others don't, challenge conventional thinking, and consistently deliver innovative, customized solutions.  As a result, we have a tangible impact on clients’ top and bottom lines. Our clients are the CEOs and executive teams of the top Global 1000 companies.

Job Specification

Practice Group:                 OW Labs

Location:                            New York

Role:                                      Senior Lead Software Engineer

Practice Overview:  OW Labs

OW Labs is an exciting internal startup within Oliver Wyman, delivering world-class solutions to our clients to drive sustained business impact. Senior Lead Software Engineers in OW Labs build high-quality software solutions and contribute to the architecture across the full technology stack, from database to analytics to web interfaces. They work in a close-knit team environment alongside other top-tier talent based in our development hubs in Dublin, London, Boston, Sydney, and a number of other locations worldwide. They are expected to continually develop their programming and professional skills and are encouraged to take advantage of regular Kaizen time for personal development.

Required Skills and Experience

  • Bachelor’s or (preferably) Master’s degree in Math or Computer Science
  • 10+ years relevant experience
  • Experience leading a team of developers
  • Work well in interdisciplinary teams
    • Co-create with other Engineers, Designers, business experts, clients, and end-users, working in a fully integrated (vs. siloed) manner
    • Interface effectively with individuals across functions and levels (both internally and externally)
    • Have extensive experience managing teams
  • Demonstrate strong communication skills, i.e.,
    • Demonstrate effective written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills, including communication of technical terms with team members/clients with non-technical backgrounds
    • Feel comfortable developing storyboards and presentations for all audiences (ranging from front line employees to executives) which will be used for a variety of purposes including sparking discussion and providing updates on project progress
  • Be a self-starter who takes initiative
    • Able to work under very little supervision and guidance, to achieve team goals and complete assignments within established time frames
    • Be flexible and willing to learn – adapt quickly to new problems and fluid project circumstances
    • Contribute to problem solving within a flat team structure; roll-up your sleeves to contribute to all aspects of the solution
  • We don’t look for specific technologies in your resume. Instead, a good candidate will have:
    • Project leadership experience; ability to handle multiple workstreams and prioritize accordingly
    • Experience with several programming languages, different programming paradigms, and operating systems
    • Experience in all stages of the project life-cycle
    • Commitment to delivering value and helping clients succeed
    • A passion for technology—open source contributions are great to see, but not required

Preferred Skills

  • Web, mobile (iOS and Android, ionic), pure back-end, or database development
  • Any modern JavaScript front-end framework: Vue.js, Angular, React, Knockout, etc.
  • Python, NumPy, Pandas, Spark, Jupyter Notebooks
  • Experience designing and building high-performance OLAP dimensional data stores
  • Presence on GitHub, Stack Overflow, or similar sites (Please supply links if available)

About Oliver Wyman Labs

OW Labs is an exciting internal startup within Oliver Wyman, delivering world-class solutions to our clients to drive sustained business impact. Senior Lead Software Engineers in OW Labs build high-quality software solutions and contribute to the architecture across the full technology stack, from database to analytics to web interfaces. They work in a close-knit team environment alongside other top-tier talent based in our development hubs in Dublin, London, Boston, Sydney, and a number of other locations worldwide. They are expected to continually develop their programming and professional skills and are encouraged to take advantage of regular Kaizen time for personal development.

Benefits

Culture of flexible working, from home, office, or anywhere you like
Career progression while staying technical
Training & continuous improvement, protected "kaizen time"
Health & wellness benefits
International travel opportunities
Great pension, 401k matching
Equal opportunity employer
Share purchase scheme
Competitive salary
Great locations around the world

items.title: Senior Front-end Engineer at Seya (New York, NY)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Frontend Developer

Job description

What we’re building.

Seya is a web-based marketplace for freelancers who primarily meet their clients face to face.  With an emphasis on authentic human connection, we are a one-stop-shop that helps freelancers find new clients and manage logistics like scheduling and payment. We’re building a modern front-end experience backed by a solid Rails architecture. We have a taste for good API design, data-driven architecture and orthogonal problem solving, and hope you do too.

About us.

We believe that everyone has something to offer. A skill to share. A lesson to teach. An experience to guide. These interactions can inspire a truly connected world. Collaboration. Laughter. Knowledge. Together we are better, stronger, smarter than alone, and genuine connections and interactions can power this reality. Seya’s mission is to enhance the way people exchange knowledge and services. At our core is human connection, empowerment and freedom, using technology to create real life experiences. We support, guide, and simplify people’s lives on the pursuit of their passions.

What you’ll be doing.

- Joining a small team of 3-4 engineers as the lead front-end developer

- Developing our first product for soft launch

Our stack.

- Ruby on Rails

- HTML/(S)CSS/SLIM

- React + REST API

- Devise, OmniAuth

- PostgreSQL

- Bootstrap

- Heroku

Skills.

- Ownership of the front-end codebase over an extended period of time

- Eye for good design and modern reactive UIs

- Small team coordination with local and remote engineers

- 7+ years experience.

Compensation.

Competitive salary based on experience.

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time

Job description

We're seeking a Senior JavaScript Developer who is excited at the prospect of working with a small, highly-skilled engineering team to scale a fast-growing SaaS product.

You will help us develop new features and maintain our codebase while supporting a wide variety of technologies. You should be proficient with front-end and JavaScript development in a modern microservice environment and familiar with the associated benefits and challenges in creating stable, performant, rapidly deployable services.

This is a 100% remote, full-time position. You’ll report directly to our CTO, who is based in New York.


About You

  • You are passionate about developing applications that communicate through elegantly designed, well-defined systems that meet defined business goals.
  • You're a great communicator, naturally curious and comfortable diving in and helping out without ego.
  • You'll have strong experience in a collaborative environment working with web applications, preferably B2B SaaS apps.


You should consider yourself an expert in:

  • JavaScript - React.js + Redux development
  • Modern ECMAScript Standards
  • HTML5 and CSS
  • Front-end build and test tools (npm, yarn, webpack, babel, jest, puppeteer)
  • Source control workflow, Git/GitFlow

  • Node.js, PHP, SQL or MongoDB proficiency
  • GraphQL
  • Apollo
  • API management, tools and documentation

Benefits


Benefits include:

  • Flexible work hours,
  • Work where you want,
  • Annual team meetup,
  • Medical, Dental & Vision,
  • Team Equity Pool

About Us

We're the leading resource scheduling application for agencies, studios and firms. Since 2012, we've been helping teams in more than 150 countries keep track of who’s working on what and when including NASA, Vice, Buzzfeed and RGA.

We’re profitable and 100% funded by our customers. Our team of twelve includes members in New York, Dallas, Cleveland, Australia, Portugal and Ukraine. We encourage people of different backgrounds, perspectives and locations to enhance our team and deliver their best work.

www.float.com

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Enterprise Software, Healthcare
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We are looking for a few great back end architects/developers to join our team.  Although we have offices in Pompano Beach, FL, you can work full-time from anywhere in the comfort of your own home (or join us in the office if you prefer, full relocation provided).  Senior (and very senior, and very very senior) level architects/developers with anywhere from 5 thru 20+ years experience are welcome to apply. Though we do not hire based on specific languages or technologies, we primarily utilize standard web technologies (JavaScript, React, etc.) and the Microsoft development stack (C#, SQL Server) on AWS (using Redis, ElasticSearch, Redshift, DynamoDb, Kinesis, etc.).

You should:

  • Have a passion for server/api/data development and technology in general
  • Enjoy and thrive in an agile, fast-moving, ever-changing startup environment
  • Welcome and take on technical challenges of all shapes and sizes
  • Be comfortable working in a distributed, semi-virtual environment
  • Be capable of creating and executing on technical direction and tasks for yourself and others
  • Be able to take minimal direction from others and provide maximal output for yourself (and others)
  • Have excellent interpersonal skills and a sense of humor

You will (just as we all do):

  • Develop back-office software, systems, and API's in an agile environment to integrate with a growing set of practice management software solutions
  • Take ownership of bringing new and improved features and functionality to our entire stack
  • Work independently within a group of developers to drive product development
  • Communicate and coordinate effectively with other independent techies and non-techies alike to ensure optimal progress towards our goals

You must:

  • Demonstrate solid working knowledge of any mainstream object oriented programming language, ideally C#, C++, Java.
  • Have a deep understanding of back end/server/api development, including application and database/data development and architectures
  • Possess broad applicable knowledge of data/database technologies including traditional RDBMS's (SQL Server), NoSql (DynamoDb), Search (ElasticSearch), Analytics/Warehousing (Redshift, EMR), Streaming (Kinesis), etc.
  • Display working knowledge of the SQL language and/or SQL-based relational database system(s) (i.e. MySql, SQL Server, Oracle, etc.)
  • Have a solid command of written and spoken English

The Perks:

  • Work from the comfort of your home or in our office in Pompano Beach, FL
  • Work in an office (when you are in the office anyhow) that understands and values techies. No cubicles, no unnecessary meetings, the freedom to produce results, excellent hardware, and people that laugh at your techie jokes
  • Responsibility for your output (and the corresponding accountability)
  • Attractive compensation
  • Other great teammates you will learn from (and vice versa)

About CentralReach

At CentralReach our mission is to redefine the way patients, providers, and payers connect, coordinate, and collaborate in care. CentralReach went live in January of 2013 and it now one of the nation's fastest growing health tech startups. Its proven incredibly viral for providers wanting to share information about their patients and critical to businesses trying to manage and grow.

Benefits

Above-market Pay
100% Medical Deductible Paid (Individual)
Telecommute Policy
20+ PTO Days a Year
Top notch techie equipment and software
Live By Beach (or wherever you happen to be)
Small, dynamic team
Vision, Dental, AD&D, Teladoc, etc.

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

ESW Capital takes an unorthodox approach to hiring in an attempt to improve the candidate experience by expediting the hiring process through an innovate online hiring tournament. Candidates will receive an offer as soon as the day of the event should they be successful.

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on May 12th to hire Java Chief Software Architects (USD $100K/yr).

This event will include testing. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager, who can hire 20 Chief Architects. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

As a Chief Architect you will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architectural problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
  • At least 8 years of experience on hands-on development and related technologies
  • Has worked with back end technologies based and latest development frameworks
  • Has experience working with two or more of data related technologies and familiarity with others from various Relational databases, Nosql databases, Caching systems, Full Text Search engines, Big Data systems.
  • Has good experience with the TDD approach, doing unit testing, mocking, integration/UI testing, behaviour driver testing.
  • Has good experience working with, setting up and configuring any continuous integration and delivery systems, any code quality automation technologies.
  • Has experience with one or more cloud or devops services like AWS, Docker, Heroku, Digitalocean, etc.
  • Has experience with one or more front end technologies including templating, CSS and JS frameworks.

We recommend that you attend the tournament instead of applying online, as our tournament process will be much faster.

Click Apply Now > Register at the green button - you will receive the webinar link after completing registration.

Benefits

Work from anywhere

Flat organization
Work with talented people all over the world
Committed to diversity
Competitive compensation

We want to give you the ability to look at code in ways it has never been looked at before, to understand the interdependency in the code.
We are empowering software development and creating higher quality code by using the latest technologies and toolsets. We are excited about using data to make decisions, we are bringing big data and analysis to software development. We are on the cutting edge of software development, and we innovate improvements on the newest technologies.   • Cloud

  • Front End
  • C++

items.title: Mobile/Web/PWA Sr. React Developer (Angular Migration): Enterprise Workflow Sys. at Primotus Division of CargoTel (Washington, DC)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Business Process Optmization, Enterprise Software, Mobile Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Overview

Primotus is migrating its Angular 1.x mobile and web frontend code to React. It consists of an Enterprise scale, user-configurable mobile workflow platform, which allows users to design an entire system - including drag-and-drop database, forms, entitlements, processes, mobile applications, business decisions, messages, reports, and even maps - with little to no software development. The platform is flexible enough to be deployed for a myriad of business verticals.

We’re looking for an experienced frontend mobile/web React developer having strong UI and architectural skills associated with data-driven applications. Candidate should have some experience with Angular (javascript and typescript) and native or hybrid mobile applications. 

If you think you’re a good fit and are interested in building something highly configurable and really innovative, please shoot us an email.

You’d be working on some of the following initiatives: 

  • Migrating from Angular 1x to React while creating unit and ETE tests
  • Building Web and Mobile data visualizations
  • Developing an Enterprise chat application
  • Developing/ingesting JSON RestfulAPIs
  • Working with team making key architecture and stack decisions
  • Coordinating with QA

You're Expected To Have:

- 5+ years of modern JavaScript (JS)
- 1+ years React production development
- 1+ years AngularJS production development
- 2+ years production mobile application development
- Production experience with TypeScript
- UI/UX and architecture skills
- JSON, REST and Web Services
- WebSockets
- Protractor Karma Jasmine or other testing tools
- Willingness to share knowledge and mentor team members

Nice To Have Some of the Following:

- Experience in one of more mobile/PWA frameworks 
- JSON document store (i.e. pouchdb) for offline storage
- Mobile and Web BI visualization tools 
- Exposure to our backend platform consisting of Scala, Akka, Kafka, ElasticSearch
- Workflow applications, particularly BPM (Activiti, Camunda, JBPM, etc). 

Our Stack : Includes many of the most-desired technologies, including:

Frontend:

  • React, Redux
  • Angular 1x, TypeScript, Ionic Mobile
  • PouchDB (mobile data store)
  • CSS3, Bootstrap
  • Protractor, Selenium (Unit, end-to-end, performance testing tools)

Backend:

  • BPMN (Java), DMN (Java)
  • Scala/Akka, Play Framework, Slick
  • Web Sockets
  • Kafka (event-based processing)
  • Postgres, ElasticSearch
  • Restful API

DevOps:

  • Jenkins 
  • Webpack
  • GIT, GitHub
  • AWS

Our development team:

  • Is small and growing with 10 members, so you'll have a significant impact. 
  • Is divided into frontend and backend teams
  • Separates code into distinct modules and services
  • Uses JSON API for backend/frontend integration
  • Applies Agile programming and paired development methodology in 3-week sprints
  • Works in a virtual environment

About Primotus Division of CargoTel

Primotus is a well-funded and stable development-stage company. Developers work remotely but we embrace paired development and sharing knowledge including "lunch-n'-learns".  We encourage developer creativity, provide a high-degree of flexibility, and don't put developers on the clock.  

Please see web site http://primotus.com for more inforation. 

Competitive salary and full benefits including medical, dental, 401k (including Primotus contributions), and flex time.

Benefits

vacation of holidays
medical and dental
flexible working hours
work at home

items.title: Senior React Developer at trade.io
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer, Frontend Developer
Industry: Cryptocurrency, Financial Technology, Forex Trading
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Summary

              Trade.io is looking for a senior-level US-based front-end developer (React) to join our globally distributed team.  This person will be working closely with the Engineering Department management to build and maintain mission-critical applications and services, including the trade.io exchange.  The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding and appreciation for development best practices and good application architecture, as well as a strong drive for excellence.  They should be open and able to learn new technologies relatively quickly based on the application requirements. This person should have a basic or higher understanding of cryptocurrencies and trading (crypto, forex, or stocks).

Starting Salary is $85 – 120k depending on experience.  This is a remote position.

Requirements

  • Advanced understanding of React and Redux
  • At least 4 years of experience with app development using JavaScript frameworks
  • Bachelor’s Degree or additional equivalent experience
  • Native English speaker or equivalent level of fluency
  • Ability to write beautiful and semantic HTML5, ES6 JavaScript, and CSS3
  • Basic understanding of trading (order types, candlestick charts, technical analysis, etc)
  • Basic understanding of the crypto community

Nice to Have

  • Proficiency with other frontend frameworks
  • Experience with backend systems
  • Graphic design skills (for the purposes of building web frontends)
  • History of involvement with Open Source community
  • Experience with Azure
  • Likes to use animated GIFs in Slack

About trade.io

trade.io is a next generation financial institution based on blockchain technology, providing the ultimate in security and transparency. By leveraging decades of experience in the investment banking, trading & fintech sectors, and combining them with the power and transparency of the distributed ledger, we’ve created a truly unique product that will revolutionize asset trading and investment banking. As well as asset trading, the trade.io exchange supports a more efficient and secure method of listing assets in the crypto economy, using the trusted record keeping capabilities that only blockchain provides. This is coupled with trade.io’s investment banking and advisory expertise and the reassurance that comes with operating in a regulated environment. Ultimately, trade.io will be a trading and financing platform for more than just crypto assets. It will also offer Forex and CFDs over precious metals, oil, commodities, indices, global equities, to name just a few. Offering more than 120 products at launch, trade.io will have the capacity to trade any number of assets.

Benefits

Remote Team
Paid Vacation
Competitive Salaries
