items.title: The New York Times : Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer

Posted Mar 29

The New York Times
Headquarters: New York, NY

View all The New York Times jobs →

Wirecutter is seeking an experienced senior full stack engineer to join the team that is responsible for the application, APIs, and client interfaces that serve our product reviews and power our business. This is a new position on a team of two-plus engineers, reporting to the engineering manager and working closely with engineers, product managers, and designers. Successful candidates thrive in a fast-paced environment, think critically, communicate clearly, collaborate, solve problems, write quality code, and ship features that achieve business goals.

As a senior engineer, you play a pivotal role in building a best-in-class product platform. You should be comfortable working remotely. Ideally, you have experience working on a distributed development team.

We have a strong focus on scale, reliability, performance, and product agility, and that means picking the right tool for the job while being pragmatic and flexible.

The tech stack for the platform team mainly consists of:
  • Laravel — PHP framework
  • Composer — dependency management
  • Vue JS
  • Grunt/Gulp — task automation
  • Sass/CSS — markup styles

This is a remote (US-only) full time position.

About Wirecutter:

Founded five years ago by journalists fed up with the time and energy it takes to shop, Wirecutter developed a simpler approach to giving buying advice: Just tell people exactly what to get in one single guide. The company’s purpose: to help people find great things, quickly and easily. Through rigorous testing, research, reporting, and whatever means necessary, we create straightforward recommendations that save readers unnecessary stress, time, and effort.  We then monetize these guides by enabling our readers to easily purchase the products they are interested in.

Wirecutter was recently acquired by, and is now a subsidiary of, The New York Times Company.  As part of the acquisition, The Times is investing in Wirecutter to accelerate its business through editorial category expansion, development of more robust product features, and unlocking of new revenue streams.

Responsibilities
  • Proactively identifies problems with requirements for their own and adjacent work. Communicates these issues early to help course-correct
  • Communicates project status clearly and effectively in a proactive manner
  • Translate UI/UX wireframes to visual elements
  • Build scalable, high-quality, and innovative solutions and features
  • Write code that is simple, reliable, maintainable, performant, functional, and compatible across devices and browsers
  • Design applications with extensibility in mind, while considering efficiency and the burden of developer onboarding
  • Debug issues reported in our production environment
  • Provide level-of-effort estimates and specifications for upcoming project tasks
  • Understand requirements, discuss trade-offs, and collaborate on the best approach to solving a problem
  • Succinctly communicate complex problems and proposed solutions, in writing and in conversation
  • Perform code reviews with meaningful feedback
  • Test and troubleshoot with automated testing or manual quality assurance

Qualifications
  • 5+ years of experience with PHP, including Laravel or another MVC frameworks
  • 3+ years of experience with JavaScript, jQuery, NPM, and the Document Object Model API
  • 3+ years of experience styling client-side views with CSS or Sass
  • Understanding of object-oriented software principles, unit testing, acceptance testing, and design patterns
  • Experience developing and consuming restful web services
  • Experience working closely with design and product teams throughout the product development life cycle
  • A deep understanding of software development, working collaboratively as part of a multidisciplinary team with a track record of shipping software on time
  • Curiosity and vision: You have a passion for technology and can think critically about performance, scalability, and reliability of software
  • Comfortable working without micromanagement of day-to-day tasks
  • Experience with version control and basic shell scripting

Nice-to-have
  • Experience with Vue JS or other JavaScript frameworks
  • Experience working with Elasticsearch
  • Experience with the JSON API specification
  • Working knowledge of AWS and Docker
  • Familiarity with WordPress or any other CMS

    Locations:
    Even with offices in New York City and Los Angeles, Wirecutter remains a highly remote culture, and open to employing people across the country (and in Canada!).  Right now, we are eligible to hire in AZ, CA, CT, CO, DC, FL, GA, IL, IN, MA, ME, MI, MN, MO, NV, NJ, NY, NC, OH, OR, PA, TX, VA, WA.  If you live outside of these states but are still interested in working with Wirecutter, you are welcome to apply, and we will keep your information on file for future opportunities.

    Apply for this position

    Please apply here: https://nytimes.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/NYT/job/New-York-NY/Senior-Software-Engineer_REQ-002740-1

items.title: IOOGO: Full Stack Engineer
items.content:
Full Stack Engineer

Posted Mar 29

IOOGO
Headquarters: Dallas, TX
www.ioogo.com
View all IOOGO jobs →

We are looking to hire a full-stack engineer who is looking for more than just a job. We are a young company and need someone with experience that can help steer us in the right direction, technically speaking. This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor and take ownership as if it were your own. 

Be comfortable with take a product from inception to production
We are building something from nothing, so you need to be comfortable with setting direction and getting things done. We want you to make solid recommendations on the technology we use based on your experience. We understand that passionate engineers love to try new technologies, as we embrace new technologies, but being a startup, we need you to recommend technologies that are best for the business. Technologies with a solid history, healthy community, reliable releases and clear documentation are more attractive than the hottest new technologies. 

Believe in our vision
Our vision is to build a suite of applications, starting with disrupting the archaic tax industry. We want you to be as excited as we are about what we are building. Our product will be your product. Our product will modernize and simplify a process that is typically seen as complex and daunting. 

Do not be afraid to wear a few hats
We all play a wide variety of roles and don't hesitate to get our hands dirty when the task calls for it. We embrace the agile framework and are constantly striving for better ways to get things done. You will work closely with and report to the Chief Operating Officer. We expect for you to grow with the company and assist in the growth of the engineering department. 

What does "full-stack" mean to us? 
We're looking for someone as comfortable with HTML5 and CSS3 as they are with their language and framework of choice on the server. You're familiar with ARIA and accessibility as well as modern browser compatibility. You're just as happy provisioning servers, scripting a release process, and designing a database as you are writing code in your language of choice. And you love automated testing and continuous integration. Ultimately, you appreciate that every decision we make has ripple effects that will be far-reaching through both the technology stack and the business. 

Be a part of a team with healthy and supportive and approach to work
If you have a passion for simplifying the difficult things in life, we'd love to talk. IOOGO is remote-friendly, allowing you to be your most productive. We also know that life events may happen between the hours of 8 and 5, so we measure performance on results, not on hours worked. We offer paid time off and we will make sure that you have the equipment you need to do your job most effectively. 

Responsibilities
  • Strong communication, analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Highly innovative, flexible and self-directed
  • Contribute to all phases of the agile development lifecycle
  • Participate in developing the best technical design and approach for new products or technologies
  • Write well designed, testable and efficient code
  • Write documentation for all code as it could set the tone for a lot of future work
  • Prepare and produce releases of software components
  • Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review

Requirements
  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject
  • Experience with the full development life cycle from inception to production
  • Any mature language and framework such as Ruby/Rails (preferred), Python/Django or C#/.net
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks
  • Experience with API design and development
  • Experience with cloud hosting services such as AWS (preferred), Azure or Google Cloud
  • Demonstrated experience working with continuous integration environments
  • Knowledge and experience of automated and test-driven development environments
  • Previous experience working in Agile / Scrum environment preferred

Apply for this position

Please fill out an application and submit your resume here: https://goo.gl/forms/XE1KO5M0iyEeukLh1.

items.title: Full-Stack Software Engineering Generalist @ PolicyStat
items.content:
Full-Stack Software Engineering Generalist @ PolicyStat

2018-03-28 21:59

Description

Make An Impact On Healthcare

PolicyStat’s mission is to improve healthcare delivery through better processes. We help our clients make their policies and procedures easier to find, access, and manage. Hundreds of hospitals use our SaaS application to ensure that this critical information is correct, their staff can find it, and that it supports regulatory compliance.

More than 250,000 Americans die each year as a result of medical error. Many of these deaths could have been prevented with existing best practices for quality and patient safety. A hospital’s best tool for standardizing and implementing these life-saving improvements are their written policies and procedures.

See more about PolicyStat and our Product team here

Full-Stack Software Engineering Generalist

As a critical member of our small product team, you’ll assume several roles including front-end, back-end, on-call support, API design, architecture, devops and database engineering.

This is a full-time position.

Minimum Requirements

  • Demonstrated proficiency with Python, JavaScript, Linux, Git
  • Ability to work effectively and collaborate on a small team
  • Excellent communication skills and strong teamwork ethic
  • Passion and enthusiasm for creating amazing products and delivering unparalleled user experience
  • Strongly motivated by opportunities to positively impact the direction of the company and products

Responsibilities

  • Periodically serve in the on-call rotation for triage of escalated support questions and server alerts.
  • Take initiative to address pain points that you and/or the team experience by working to improve the software, tools or processes of PolicyStat.
  • Review code contributed by the team and work with them to get it ready for production.
  • Design, develop, document, and write automated unit tests for new features
  • Proactively analyze, diagnose, and resolve software regressions.
  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code.

Highly Desired Skills

  • Demonstrated expertise with any of the following:
    • MySQL
    • React
    • GraphQL
    • LDAP & IPSec
    • SAML2
  • Demonstrated success in a fast-paced startup environment
  • A GitHub profile with lots of code and experience contributing to open source projects
  • Familiarity with AWS and/or GCP
  • Familiarity with serverless architecture

Compensation and Benefits

  • Meaningful, market-based salary starting at $80k USD annually
  • Health (including telemedicine) with HSA, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance
  • 10 paid holidays
  • PTO: 15 days first year. 20 days starting the calendar year of third anniversary

Interview Process

  • Application review
  • Complete a small timed work sample (no more than 45 minutes) in Python that consists of 3 programming challenges designed to represent what your day to day work would look like.
  • Conversation with the Product team lead
  • Complete a timed work sample project (no more than 4 hours) that is representative of the kind of projects you'll be working on.
  • Culture conversation with the team

About PolicyStat

  • Founded in 2006, acquired by iContracts in 2017
  • 99% customer retention rate
  • ~50% annual growth over the last 6 years
  • Deployed ~650 times in 2016
  • Technology stack: Python 2.7+ (help us upgrade to Python 3), Django, AWS (RDS, EC2, S3), Ubuntu Linux, MySQL, GraphQL, React (work in progress)
  • Development Toolkit: Git, Vagrant, VirtualBox, Trello, GitHub

Country

Anywhere*

Location

UTC-8 to UTC+3

items.title: Full stack web developer
items.content:
Full stack web developer at Bulb Software

London, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Node.js, PostgreSQL, Angular.JS, React.js, Front-End/Full-Stack (UI-AngularJS-JS-NodeJS)
Compensation
€55K–€80K
0.5%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

We're looking for experienced full stack developers that love crafting beautiful web apps and smart applications. If you're at this stage of your career where you're looking for a position where you can contribute directly to product development and really make a difference in the business (and be rewarded for it) we should talk!

***MUST HAVES***

Your background:
- You have a Bsc/MsC in computer Science, mathematics or any other degree or experience that demonstrates highly analytical skills
- You've got a successful experience working for a startup
- You've helped your team build a great B2B/SaaS (rather complex) product and can demonstrate your direct contribution in achieving this

Your skills:
- 3+ years experience working with our technology stack (e.g. html5/CSS3, Angular JS, React JS, Node JS)
- You can demonstrate ability to quickly understand customer/business problems and you're pretty creative at finding solutions to solve them.
- You own your features from A to Z and can ship the features expected with clean code, quickly.
- You have a strong UX/UI focus but can dive into backend when required (Node JS and postgreSQL required)
- You're comfortable with customer facing interactions

Personality traits we’ll be looking for:
- You've got tons of curiosity
- You learn insanely fast and adapt to change easily
- You've demonstrated grit, tenacity to achieve challenging goals (personal and/or at work)
- High EQ: you communicate well and can get along with all our team members (rather they're in product or growth parts of the business)
- You have strong work ethic and are autonomous

***NICE TO HAVES***
- You speak another foreign language (e.g. French, German, Spanish, Italian)
- Experience with finance/accounting, fleet/asset management software

***SALARY/COMPENSATION***
We believe a small team of rock stars can accomplish at least 10x more than an average team so we recruit very selectively and for the right candidate our salary/compensation package can be pretty competitive. We also offer flexible/remote working conditions however team get-togethers are required from time to time, especially during your onboarding (expect somewhere fun in South Europe, but that's a surprise!), so you need to be opened to travel.

items.title: Codeable: Senior Frontend engineer - Angular/JS/CSS/HTML
items.content:
Senior Frontend engineer - Angular/JS/CSS/HTML

Posted Mar 28

Codeable
Headquarters: Remote (European hours preferred)
https://codeable.io
View all Codeable jobs →

How is this job different?

It's not THAT different, but we - the people working at Codeable - are.
Codeable is a premium outsourcing company where we value quality above all else, even though we all work remotely we are a tight-knit team, and do our best because we all believe in making the outsourcing space a better place for everyone involved. Freelancers (we call them Experts) and Clients.

We're a bunch of nerds - be it tech, design or business wise - and we are proud of it. We have a good sense of humor and actually manage to get a surprising amount of work done between cracking jokes and having a good time.

What do you even do?

We're a startup (we were just 5 years old on 7th of January 2018) and we have been growing 40%-60% year on year and we’re profitable. We are the leading premium outsourcing platform for the WordPress market. Codeable is the platform that connects clients with WordPress Experts and you will be working on improving and maintaining that platform.

At Codeable we are all about quality and we're well known for our awesome customer support. Just in case you don't believe us, here is a random quote from one of our customers: "Great job by another very talented Codeable tech! I'll definitely be back.".
We currently have around 12 full-time staff members (programmers, marketing, customer support...) and a few working for us part-time (UX, Design). That said, we are currently lacking power in the Frontend  "department".


What am I going to do?

The thing you do best. We believe that we can get the best out of our people if we focus on the things they do best.
If chosen, you will have a month (or two) long testing period where we see how you fit in the team and how you perform at your work.
A proactive approach is most wanted since we're not a big company. Meaning if you see something that should be fixed or made better and you can do it, then do it.

If you know you can improve something, just do it.

Now to the real business...

Our frontend code needs a bit of a "face-lift" and some optimization and refactoring. At the same time, we would like to change a bit how we are building our application. We're not aiming for the "big rewrite". What we have in mind is a gradual approach to improving our code. An evolution of some kind.


What do I need?

  • Good grasp of JavaScript and AngularJS v1
  • Solid knowledge of SPA applications
  • Familiarity with continuous integration and continuous deployment and agile methodologies
  • Understanding of REST
  • Great relationship with Git
  • Previous experience with refactoring code (preferably not just your own)
  • Experience with writing tests (unit/integration/…) - we don’t have many but we’d like to have many more
  • Curious gene (you have to love testing new stuff and doubting and improving old)
  • A habit of QA-ing your own work locally and on staging environment before deployment (of course)
  • Openness to other platforms and approaches/methodologies. AngularJS is not a religion for us.
  • Being familiar with React and its ecosystem is a plus since we do have a smaller in-house app running on React.



What will make me cut the hiring line? (any skills below)

  • Working during European hours (we’re mostly European with exception of our customer support staff which is spread around the globe)
  • Extraordinary refactoring skills
  • Experience with UX/UI design
  • Back-end development experience (Ruby, Rails, SQL, PostgreSQL)
  • DevOps knowledge about CI, CD, Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Jenkins, ...
  • Experience with data collection/warehousing/storing for analytics purposes



Your responsibilities a bit more detailed

  • Developing new and maintaining old features
  • Designing and shaping the new version of our SPA  (v2 is getting old)
  • Collaborating with Backend developers to find the best solution for improvements or new features
  • Helping us all develop a good programming/development culture (freedom of choice and sense of responsibilities/ownership )
  • Participation in dailies (every working day at 09:30 AM (GMT+1)



What am I going to get?

  • An option to work remotely... Duh! :D
  • Freedom of choice => right tool/libraries for the job (but own it - if it breaks it's your responsibility).
  • Flexible working hours => only 09:30 am daily is mandatory - can be skipped on occasions if requested.
  • Competitive salary => If you are that good, then you deserve it!
  • Team building/meetups => Since we're all working remotely we have the need for human touch once in a while, this is when we meet together, eat some nice food, do some sightseeing, talk and work together.
  • A working environment where people care about what they do

Apply for this position

Send a resume and a cover letter to jobs@codeable.io
